location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no. 2931 of 1858, Henry Lacon Anderson, Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay Castle, to Captain Felix Jones, Political Resident, Persian Gulf

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: This item has a foliation sequence of a small number in the top right hand corner of each folio.

mods.abstract: This letter acknowledges receipt of Captain Felix Jones' report (29 July 1858, no. 250) on the communication of Sultan bin Suggar of Rasul Khyma [Ras al-Khaimah]. The letter forwards a resolution (dated 7th November 1858) by the Honorable Board approving the action of the Resident in preventing a naval action against the Sucheyhue [Shihuh] tribe. The Resident is instructed to inform Sheikh Sultan bin Suggur that it the Resident to whom complaints should be addressed.
